content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}

Now given a task: Browse Coursera, which universities offer Master of Advanced Study in Engineering degrees? Tell me what is the latest application deadline for this degree?  Please interact with https://www.coursera.org/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open search; click search icon.
Action: Click [305]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Textbox is focused; need to search the degree.
Action: Type [2334]; master of advanced study in engineering
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to open degree page to find deadline; click link to degree at [3596].
Action: Click [3596]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to return to search results page to see if other universities also have MAS-E degree.
Action: GoBack
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To limit results to degree offerings, need to open Filters.
Action: Click [7903]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to check if there are additional degree offerings beyond the Berkeley one; scroll further down the results list.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Close Filters panel to enable clean interaction, then will open Berkeley MAS Engineering degree page.
Action: Click [7914]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to check if more results appear further down the list; scroll page further to confirm if other universities offer MAS Engineering.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down

Observation: please analyze the accessibility tree and give the Thought and Action.

	[11636] heading "Earn your master's from Berkeley Engineering without putting your career on pause"
	[11640] StaticText 'Ready to advance, transform, and enhance your career in engineering and technology? Earn your Master of Advanced Study in Engineering (MAS-E) from Berkeley Engineering,\xa0'
	[11642] StaticText 'consistently ranked among the top three engineering schools in the country by\xa0'
	[11645] StaticText 'U.S. News & World Report'
	[11649] StaticText 'Designed for part-time, self-paced study, the MAS-E program gives you the ability to complete your master’s without putting your career on pause.\xa0'
	[11651] StaticText 'Learn on your schedule with courses across four distinct concentrations, providing you with extended skill sets across different types of engineering'
	[11652] StaticText '. Through this program, you will learn from and interact with the elite faculty at Berkeley Engineering to develop the critical knowledge and technical skills you need to succeed at the highest levels in your career.'
	[11653] heading 'Customize your degree for your unique career goals'
	[11657] StaticText 'Design your degree learning journey with the '
	[11658] link 'Berkeley MAS-E Degree Planner,' url: https://mas-e.engineering.berkeley.edu/curriculum-planner/?concentration=infrastructure-energy-and-the-environment
	[11660] StaticText ' your comprehensive guide to exploring and creating your unique plan to help you meet your career goals. Save and share your plan with a Berkeley Engineering academic advisor.'
	[11662] StaticText 'With 4 distinct interdisciplinary concentrations to choose from, the degree is truly versatile to provide a well-rounded engineering education:'
	[11669] heading 'Infrastructure, energy, and the environment'
	[11672] StaticText 'This concentration puts you on track for roles such as Infrastructure Project Manager, Structural Engineer, Sustainability Consultant, and Geotechnical Engineer.'
	[11679] heading 'Advanced Manufacturing and Materials'
	[11682] StaticText 'This concentration puts you on track for roles such as Manufacturing Engineer, Materials Scientist, Product Development Engineer, and Industrial Engineer.'
	[11689] heading 'Electronics and systems engineering'
	[11692] StaticText 'This concentration puts you on track for roles such as Electrical Engineer, and Renewable Energy Engineer.'
	[11699] heading 'Robotics and Controls'
	[11702] StaticText 'This concentration puts you on track for roles such as Robotics Engineer, and Autonomous Systems Developer.'
	[11705] StaticText 'Learn more about the '
	[11706] link 'curriculum' url: https://www.coursera.org/degrees/mas-engineering-berkeley/academics
	[11709] StaticText ' or '
	[11710] link 'career outcomes' url: https://www.coursera.org/degrees/mas-engineering-berkeley/careers
	[11714] heading "Berkeley's MAS-E in the headlines"
	[12551] button 'Start your application'
	[12554] button 'Request More Information'

ANSWER; Coursera currently lists one Master of Advanced Study in Engineering (MAS‑E) degree program:

• University of California, Berkeley – College of Engineering

Latest (final) application deadline for this degree: May 9
Format ERROR: Both 'Thought' and 'Action' should be included in your reply.

Thought: The degree search shows only one Master of Advanced Study in Engineering program, offered by UC Berkeley, and its page states the final application deadline is May 9.  
Action: ANSWER; Coursera lists one Master of Advanced Study in Engineering (MAS‑E) degree: University of California, Berkeley – College of Engineering. The latest (final) application deadline for this degree is May 9.
